Package com.empirilytics.qatch.analyzers.java

Class CKJMAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
com.empirilytics.qatch.analyzers.java.CKJMAnalyzer
All Implemented Interfaces:
MetricsAnalyzer
public class CKJMAnalyzer extends Object implements MetricsAnalyzer
This class is responsible for analyzing a single project by invoking the CKJM tool.

This can be done by using the first and the second method of this class respectively.

  • Method Details

    • analyze

      public void analyze(@NotNull @NotNull String src, @NotNull @NotNull String dest)
      This method is used to analyze a single project with the CKJM static analysis tool.

      ATTENTION: - The appropriate build.xml ant file should be placed inside the eclipse folder. - TODO: Check if you can provide the path of the build.xml.

      Specified by:
      analyze in interface MetricsAnalyzer
      Parameters:
      src - : The path of the folder that contains the class files of the project, cannot be null
      dest - : The path where the XML file that contains the results will be placed, cannot be null

    • analyze

      public void analyze(@NotNull @NotNull String src, @NotNull @NotNull String dest, @NotNull @NotNull com.empirilytics.qatch.core.model.PropertySet properties)
      This method is responsible for analyzing a single project against a set of properties by using the CKJM Tool.

      Typically this method does the following:

      1. Iterates through the PropertySet. 2. If it finds at least one property that uses the CKJM tool then it calls the simple analyze() method.

      IDEA: - All the metrics are calculated for the project and then loaded by the program. - After that we decide which metrics to keep by iterating through the PropertySet of the Quality Model.

      It has this form in order to look the same with the PMDAnalyzer.

      Specified by:
      analyze in interface MetricsAnalyzer
      Parameters:
      src - The path of the folder that contains the class files of the desired project, cannot be null
      dest - The path where the XML file that contains the results should be placed, cannot be null
      properties - The set of properties to evaluate against, cannot be null
